name: TheAtlantic
text: Senator Kamala Harris wants to be Joe Biden's running mate. She just won't say so. @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/KkSF3Nk8gi

name: TheAtlantic
text: Once the epicenter of the global pandemic, New York is trying to discourage visitors from new coronavirus hotspots, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/2ktXcQKDJi

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Even quarantine fatigue feels old now. Whether you live in an area that is reopening or one that is experiencing a new surge of cases, our critics can help. Here’s what to read, listen to, and watch this weekend. https://t.co/2lwnHfhvmF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This is the time to move. This is the time to make change." @JulianCastro talks with @AdamSerwer about police reform, the housing crisis, and his own political future: https://t.co/YLoFwDixpj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases are on the rise in twenty-five states. A vaccine is, for now, a distant dream. How do we negotiate the ethical trade-offs in the meantime? https://t.co/ydOMH1C99Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Britain has finally passed a new law allowing for no-fault divorce, all without a culture war, writes @helenlewis: https://t.co/JKey2zlqCS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mountaintop yoga in China, a sunrise over Glastonbury Tor, a sneaky gull in Denmark, a field of lavender in England, “Rays of Victory” in Russia, a concert for plants in Spain, a ski run in Australia, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/t1yFCW3kvI

name: TheAtlantic
text: A poem by Robert Hayden, published in The Atlantic in 1947: https://t.co/40mBECsmSh

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the FBI's Art Theft Program, seizing troves of looted cultural treasures is often the easy part, writes @amberldance. https://t.co/NYec6Df3Mc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nearly one in five Americans says they have participated in a recent protest, but what do mass demonstrations actually accomplish? @zeynep explains: https://t.co/yP7N3PLk2D

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers may have captured, for the first time, the flare from a faraway cosmic collision of two black holes, @marinakoren reports. https://t.co/CglcrZMVX5

name: TheAtlantic
text: In a new book, researchers describe three impossible demands of American life: being a perfect worker, being a perfect parent, and having a perfect body. Working parents bear the burden of all three, one of the authors told @jpinsk. https://t.co/VllvCCYbxo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Princeton announced today that it will remove Woodrow Wilson's name from its public-policy school in light of his “racist thinking.” In 2015, Dick Lehr detailed Wilson's troubling history with race: https://t.co/WlFvRVqTz4
